ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Now I have some questions about your physical health and medical history. First, at the present time, would you say your health is excellent, very good, good, fair, or poor?
Notes: 1 = Excellent; 2 = Very Good; 3 = Good; 4 = Fair; 5 = Poor; 999 = Missing

ElementDescription: Has your health always been (ANSWER IN MH1), or has it been better or worse?
Notes: 1 = No, worse; 2 = No, better; 5 = Yes, same; 6 = Both better and worse; 999 = Missing

ElementDescription: How many times have you been in a hospital overnight (including surgery and pregnancy), excluding psychiatric or substance abuse treatment?
How many times have you had surgery when you did not have to stay in a hospital overnight (that is, outpatient surgery)?
How many times have you been examined or treated in the emergency room because of an accident or injury?
In the last 6 months, how many visits have you made to a doctor, clinic, or emergency room for your physical health? Do not count chiropractors
Have you ever taken any medications prescribed to you by a doctor for 12 months or longer: To make you feel less nervous? Do not count OTC
Have you ever taken any medications prescribed to you by a doctor for 12 months or longer: To help you sleep? Do not count OTC
Have you ever taken any medications prescribed to you by a doctor for 12 months or longer: To feel less depressed? Do not count OTC
Have you ever taken any medications prescribed to you by a doctor for 12 months or longer: For headaches? Do not count OTC
Have you ever taken any medications prescribed to you by a doctor for 12 months or longer: To have more energy? Do not count OTC
Have you ever taken any medications prescribed to you by a doctor for 12 months or longer: (Women Only) For birth control? Do not count OTC
Have you ever taken any medications prescribed to you by a doctor for 12 months or longer: Containing steroids? Do not count OTC
How many times have you been an inpatient in a psychiatric hospital or ward or in a chemical dependency program where you stayed two or more nights?
How old were you the first time you were treated as an inpatient?
How old were you the last time you were treated as an inpatient?
Have you ever received outpatient treatment, for 12 months or longer, for psychiatric, emotional, or chemical dependency problems? This includes seeing a psychiatrist or psychologist.
Are you currently in treatment?
Medical History Notes
